Project: Atikokan General Hospital - Renovation and Expansion
Description: Renovating roughly 8,500 sq. ft. and adding roughly 10,000 sq. ft.
Result: More space for 11 acute-care and other types of beds, as well as improved air handling, boiler and sprinkler systems

Project: The Royal Victoria Hospital of Barrie - Phase 1 Redevelopment
Description: Construction of  4 bunker-3 machines at the Simcoe Muskoka Regional Cancer Centre (SMRCC) and the Phase 1 redevelopment of the Royal Victoria Hospital.
Result: An additional 101 inpatient beds, expanded emergency and ambulatory care, two new operating rooms as well as enhancements to related services such as laboratory and diagnostic imaging.

Project: Quinte Healthcare Corporation Renovation
Description: Renovations to the medical device reprocessing department (MDRD) and central sterilization room.
Result: Improved infection control, and enhanced preventive maintenance capabilities.

Project: Anishnawbe Mushkiki AHAC - N'Mninoeayaa AHAC Site
Description: Construct a satellite building adjacent to the existing facility
Result: Additional file storage and meeting space in Cutler.

Project: William Osler Health System - New Peel Memorial Centre for Integrated Health and Wellness
Description: Construction of a new centre
Result: Improved urgent care, ambulatory care, clinical support and corporate administrative services in Brampton

Project: William Osler Health System - Peel Memorial Centre for Integrated Health Wellness – Phase 2 Redevelopment Lynch Site
Description: Construction of an addition to the newly built Phase 1 facility to accommodate non-acute inpatient services including complex continuing care and rehabilitation beds. William Osler Health System is planning to provide post-acute care at Peel Memorial Hospital for patients recovering from an acute care stay before they safely return home. Bringing this specialized care to Peel Memorial will enable more acute care beds to be added to Brampton Civic Hospital.
Result: Service expansion and Improved access to upgraded and modernized facilities.

Project: Brockville General Hospital - Renovation and Expansion for Mental Health, Complex Continuing Care and Rehabilitation
Description: Consolidating services from two locations into new 4-storey tower
Result: 32 new inpatient beds for complex continuing care, acute mental health and rehabilitation

Project: Joseph Brant Hospital - Renovation and Expansion
Description: Construction of new tower and renovations to existing building
Result: 7-storey, 414,920 sq. ft.-tower and 128.225 sq. ft. of renovated space to increase inpatient, surgical and ICU beds and to support expanded services (e.g. specialized nursery, emergency)

Project: Cambridge Memorial Hospital - Renovation and Expansion
Description: Renovation and new acute care wing
Result: Additional beds and increased program space, and infrastructure improvement.

Project: New Groves Memorial Community Hospital
Description: Construction of a new hospital located in Aboyne, between Fergus and Elora
Result: New hospital of approximately 130,000 sq ft with 45 inpatient beds

Project: Lakeridge Health - Bowmanville Site Redevelopment
Description: Renovation and expansion for the emergency department, inpatient units, and the diagnostic imaging department at the Bowmanville site.
Result: Expanded programs and services capacity

Project: Collingwood General & Marine Hospital - Hospital Redevelopment
Description: The project includes renovation and will add to the current Hosptial on site. will relocate the hospital to a new site.
Result: The project will address aging infrastructure and allow for expansion of the intensive care, inpatient care, emergency, obstetrics and the operating suite.

Project: Cornwall Community Hospital
Description: Construction of a wing and renovations to consolidate all acute and rehabilitation hospital services from two sites onto the McConnell Avenue site. The redevelopment includes demolition of the existing west wing to accommodate new construction for the emergency room, diagnostic imaging, surgical suite, surgical daycare, sterile processing department and mechanical room.
Result: Creation of 157 acute care, 20 acute mental health and 24 rehabilitation beds.

Project: Espanola Regional Hospital and Health Centre Emergency Department Expansion
Description: Renovations  to the emergency department
Result: Increased capacity from 5 to 11 treatment bays

Project: Kingston Community Health Centres - Napanee and Area Satellite
Description: A 19,000 gross square foot facility at 26 Dundas Street West in Napanee.
Result: The CHC will offer primary health care programs and services including individual, family and group therapy and indigenous programs for its catchment population.

Project: Health Sciences North (formerly L'Hopital Regional de Sudbury Regional Hospital) - Northern Ontario School of Medicine
Description: This project will build a state-of-the-art facility to serve as a training ground for future doctors, nurses, lab technicians, paramedics and other health professionals. The project includes spaces for academic administration, meeting / learning suites and a new Simulation Lab.
Result: New and improved space for students in Northern Ontario School of Medicine

Project: Grey Bruce Health Services - Markdale Hospital Redevelopment
Description: Replacement of old hospital with new  facility.
Result: Expansion of service and infrastructure improvement.

Project: Hamilton Health Sciences  - West Lincoln Memorial Hospital Redevelopment Project
Description: Construction of a new facility on the existing site to provide 61 inpatient beds and allow HHS to preserve emergency, obstetric, surgical and ambulatory services in the Grimsby area in a modern setting for infection prevention and control and improved patient flow and safety.
Result: Service expansion and Improved access to upgraded and modernized facilities.

Project: Hamilton Health Sciences Centre - McMaster University Medical Centre Renovations
Description: Renovations at three different locations
Result: 34,000 sq. ft. of renovated space between MUMC and Hamilton General Hospital; 10,600 sq. ft. renovated at existing building to house West End Urgent Care Centre

Project: Hamilton Health Sciences Centre - Stem Cell Expansion
Description: The project will provide new private rooms and related support space at the Juravinski site. The new beds will accommodate patients receiving stem cell transplants and those with acute leukemia.  The adjacent Oncology Day Services will also be renovated and expanded to new treatment spaces. Pharmacy, clinic and laboratory storage space will also be expanded or renovated.
Result: Additional beds and increased program space, and infrastructure improvement.

Project: St. Joseph's Healthcare (Hamilton) - Centre for Mountain Health Service
Description: Construction of a new facility of approximately 800,000 square feet, to support existing longer-term mental health, forensics and acute mental health programs and services, expansion of forensic services, geriatric psychiatry and mental health rehabilitation
Result: Increased capacity of inpatient beds from 214 to up to 305 along with all associated support services; expanded outpatient clinics for psychiatry, diagnostic imaging, medical services and education, etc.

Project: Hamilton Health Sciences - Hamilton Redevelopment
Description: The project involves the redevelopment and expansion of the hospital's Juravinski site.  This project will replace and upgrade components of the hospital's existing infrastructure including extensive renovations and construction of a new patient care tower.
Result: Replacement of aging infrastructure, increase in number of beds and expansion of hospital programs.

Project: Hopital General de Hawkesbury and District General Hospital - Renovation and Expansion
Description: New construction and renovations to create expanded space, services and technology
Result: Expanded services (e.g. emergency, intensive care, diagnostic imaging, complex continuing care) and new units (e.g. acute mental health, operating room)

Project: South Bruce Grey Health Centre - Kincardine Site Redevelopment
Description: Renovations and expansion to the emergency department, radiation decontamination/treatment room, diagnostic imaging and lab, as well as major infrastructure upgrades
Result: Improved access to health care services for area residents

Project: New Providence Care Hospital
Description: Major redevelopment project
Result: Bringing mental health, rehabilitation and complex continuing care (e.g. geriatrics) into one location, with 270 inpatient beds

Project: Kingston General Hospital - Redevelopment
Description: The hospital redevelopment includes demolition of old buildings, extensive renovations and new construction.
Result: Improved access to the catheterization laboratory, surgical suites, clinical laboratories, emergency department, neonatal intensive care unit, labour and delivery suite, and inpatient unit.

Project: Grand River Hospital - Kitchener Waterloo Site Restructuring
Description: Restructuring renovation and new construction project and upgrades to the intensive care unit, operating rooms and diagnostic imaging and ambulatory care departments.
Result: Expanded acute adult mental health as well as up to 12 new beds for the  child and adolescent inpatient mental health program,

Project: St. Joseph's Health Care (London) - Parkwood Mental Health
Description: Parkwood / St. Thomas Mental Health
Result: New Brownfield facility at Parkwood site for longer-term mental health and at St. Thomas site for forensics. Parkwood Site: up to 156 beds in operation at opening; clinical programs, clinical support services, food and nutrition, education and learning, patient and family services, main pharmacy.  St. Thomas Site: up to 89 beds proposed; forensic psychiatric services, clinical support services, food and nutrition services, education and learning, patient and family services, satellite pharmacy.

Project: London Health Sciences Centre - Stem Cell Transplant Unit Expansion
Description: Renovations to the stem cell transplant unit, logistical and support areas, associated spaces including inpatient pharmacy and ambulatory clinics and co-location of inpatient and transplant day unit areas.
Result: Expansion of stem cell therapy capacity, and the creation of new outpatient and chemotherapy pharmacy spaces and expanded outpatient clinics.

Project: Noojmowin Teg Health Centre Expansion
Description: 4,400 sq. ft.-addition to replace temporary buildings
Result: New space for traditional healers, a traditional healing lodge and health care professionals.

Project: Markham Stouffville Hospital Redevelopment
Description: Renovating and adding a 4-storey addition to the existing facility to accommodate complex continuing care/rehabilitation, critical care, emergency, ambulatory care, maternal child, acute inpatient, mental health and surgical services; associated clinical support services; and administrative services in up-to-date facilities.
Result: The redeveloped hospital will accommodate 309 acute and non-acute beds, 101,000 clinic visits and 67,715 ER visits, projected to 2015/16.

Project: Halton Healthcare Services Corporation - Milton District Hospital Expansion
Description: Construction of 4-storey patient care building of approximately 330,800 square feet
Result: Supporting clinical programs and expanding services (e.g. critical care, maternal/child, emergency)

Project: Trillium Health Partners - Credit Valley Hospital - Renovation and Expansion
Description: Renovations to approximately 187,000 sq. ft. of existing hospital space to address priority clinical programs
Result: Expanded  emergency department, critical care unit, surgical services, and diagnostic imaging department

Project: Trillium Health Partners
Description: Renovations at the Queensway Health Centre, Mississauga Hospital and Credit Valley Hospital sites.
Result: Renovations to accommodate additional exam rooms, workstations and a meeting room at the Queensway Health Centre, and workstations, meeting rooms and on-call rooms at the Mississauga Hospital and Credit Valley Hospital sites.
Address: 100 Queensway W2200 Eglinton Ave W150 Sherway Dr

Project: Trillium Hospital Partners - Mississauga and Queensway Sites
Description: The project involves the complete redevelopment of the Mississauga Hospital site for acute care services, along with the consolidation of services, and a new inpatient tower at the Queensway Health Centre to consolidate the majority of Complex Continuing Care and Rehabilitation services. The project also includes enabling works projects to address parking capacity during the project and the relocation of high voltage services.The project at the Mississauga Hospital and Queensway Health Centre sites includes an early works project to address parking and the central utility plant; complete redevelopment of the Mississauga Hospital Site; and addition of a new patient tower at the Queensway Health Centre site.
Result: The project addresses aging infrastructure and adds new space to allow for program and service improvement and expansion.

Project: Weeneebayko Area Health Authority - Replacement Facility
Description: New hospital, and Elder Care Lodge in Moosonee and a new ambulatory care center in Moose Factory.
Result: This project will address aging infrastructure/poor physical condition of existing facilities, by building replacement facilities that will enable the provision of culturally safe health care for clients and patients for residents in Moosonee, Moose Factory, and along the James Bay Coast

Project: Muskoka Algonquin Healthcare - Hospital Redevelopment Projects
Description: The Project will include a phased redevelopment of Muskoka Algonquin Healthcare's two hospital sites in Bracebridge and Huntsville.
Result: Enhance patient safety, meet modern standards and increase patient access to inpatient, stroke, ambulatory and emergency services.

Project: Niagara Health Systems - New South Niagara Hospital & New Welland UCC
Description: Construction of a new multi-floor general acute care hospital on a greenfield site in South Niagara. The new site will replace four of Niagara Health’s existing sites.
Result: The project will upgrade aging infrastructure, consolidate services, and add space to allow for new bed capacity and expansion of services.

Project: Halton Healthcare Services Corporation - Oakville Trafalgar Memorial Hospital Rebuild
Description: New and expanded hospital to replace aging Oakville Trafalgar Memorial Hospital
Result: Space for up to 457 beds with future capacity to accommodate 704 beds. Expansion of services, including ambulatory care, inpatient treatment, diagnostic services, rehabilitation services, complex continuing care, and a variety of support services.

Project: Hôpital Montfort - New Orléans Family Health Hub
Description: Construction of a new 96,000 square foot facility to colocate complementary services from seven hospitals and community health providers
Result: Improved access to complementary bilingual health care services including ambulatory care, mental health, geriatric, diagnostic imaging and rehabilitation with a focus on health and wellness, chronic condition management and specialty services.

Project: University of Ottawa Heart Institute - Cardiac Life Support Services Renovation and Expansion
Description: Construction of a 6-floor addition and renovation of the current facility
Result: 234,000-sq. ft. of  new and renovated space to include 6 additional cardiac surgery intensive care unit beds, added operating room, 2 additional electrophysiology labs as well as new chiller/cooling towers and emergency generators

Project: The Ottawa Hospital - Stem Cell Program
Description: Renovation and expansion of space for the Stem Cell Program
Result: Increase in number of inpatient and day hospital beds, treatment bays, and exam rooms while reducing wait times and costly inconvenient transfers out of the country.

Project: Bruyère Continuing Care - Renovations
Description: Renovation of 15,382 sq. ft. on the 4th floor of the Y Wing Elisabeth Bruyère Hospital (EBH) site to expand the Geriatric Day Hospital (GDH) by about 1,172 attendances for a total of 6,735 (serving an average of 30 clients per day).
Result: The GDH supports the coordination and integration of Geriatric Emergency Management (GEM) in nine hospitals with geriatric and community support services, to sustain seniors in the community.

Project: The Ottawa Hospital - Civic Campus Redevelopment
Description: Redevelopment of the Ottawa Hospital's Civic Campus on a new site, including construction of a new state-of-the-art facility
Result: Service expansion, increased beds, increased education spaces and Improved access to upgraded and modernized facilities.

Project: Quinte Health Care - Prince Edward County Memorial Hospital Redevelopment
Description: This is a hospital replacement project in Picton adjacent to the existing facility.
Result: The project replaces aging infrastructure and will provide a net increase of in-patient beds to accommodate growth at the site.

Project: Renfrew Victoria Hospital Expansion and Dialysis Centre
Description: New construction and renovation  across back of ER/Ambulatory Care wing
Result: Increased hemodialysis treatment from 14 to 20 stations

Project: Stevenson Memorial Hospital - Redevelopment Phase 1
Description: Construction of an addition to the existing facility to replace, expand and modernize inpatient beds and services, emergency services, surgical services, diagnostic services and a birthing suite.
Result: Enhance patient safety and increase access to inpatient and critical care services.

Project: St. Thomas Elgin General Hospital - Expansion for Emergency, Ambulatory and Mental Health
Description: Construction of a new wing
Result: A new 106,283 sq. ft. wing to house new acute mental health inpatient unit, mental health outpatient day hospital, plus new departments (e.g. emergency, ambulatory care)

Project: Health Sciences North - Bed Capacity Project
Description: The project will allow for conversion of the existing space at Ramsey Lake Health Centre  into new conventional patient bed spaces complete with support services.
Result: The project will create over 50 new patient bed spaces.

Project: St. Joseph's Hospital  - Expansion for Specialized Mental Health Rehabilitation
Description: Construction of new east wing for specialized mental health care.
Result: 38 beds added for people needing active and long-term psychiatric rehabilitation and geriatric psychiatry.

Project: Thunder Bay Regional Health Sciences Centre - Cardiovascular Surgery Program
Description: The Project involves new construction and renovation of space at Thunder Bay Regional Health Sciences Centre and includes a cardiovascular surgical inpatient unit, an additional operating room, a vascular lab and outpatient clinic.
Result: Improved access to cardiovascular surgery and related services for residents of Thunder Bay and Northwestern Ontario.

Project: Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre - Off-site and On-site Dialysis Centre
Description: Two phase project - Off-site includes renovations to the CNIB site and the on-site component includes interior renovations to Sunnybrook's dialysis centre in the hospital at the Bayview campus.
Result: Outpatient dialysis centre with 24 stations and hospital-based dialysis centre with 15 stations.

Project: Casey House - New Replacement Facility
Description: New construction and renovations
Result: Increased space for expanding residential, home and hospice services, as well as new Day Health Program for people with HIV/AIDS.

Project: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health Phase 1 C Project - New Client Care Building and Centre for Discovery and Knowledge Exchange
Description: Construction of two new buildings at the Queen Street site.
Result: Modernized facilities for improved inpatient beds, ambulatory programs and relocation of Emergency Department/Emergency Access Unit.

Project: New Humber River Hospital
Description: Consolidating services from three locations into one
Result: 1.8 million sq. ft.-building to become Ontario’s first digital hospital, while increasing beds from 549 to 656, expanding emergency services and more

Project: Michael Garron Hospital - New Patient Care Tower
Description: New tower for inpatient and outpatient care
Result: Additional beds and increased program space, and infrastructure improvement.

Project: Mount Sinai Hospital - Surgery, Critical Care and Emergency Room Renovation
Description: The project is a large-scale renovation of key areas of the Mount Sinai Hospital, including Critical Care Unit; expansion and redesign of the Emergency Department, Operating Rooms and Surgical Services.
Result: Additional beds and increased program space, and infrastructure improvement.

Project: Unity Health Toronto - St. Michael's Hospital Patient Care Tower
Description: Construction of a 17-storey tower and renovation of 150,000 square feet of existing space
Result: Replacing undersized, outdated patient rooms; adding 5 state-of-the-art operating rooms and space for ambulatory and ophthalmology clinics

Project: The Salvation Army Toronto Grace Health Centre Infrastructure Upgrades
Description: Upgrades to more than 70,000 sq. ft. to TGHC and renovations to more than 50,000 sq. ft. of space at UHN Hillcrest
Result: Improvements to air quality for patients and staff, safety in patient rooms, washrooms and showers; patients will be able to find and use programs and services more easily

Project: University Health Network - Bickle Centre Infrastructure Upgrades
Description: Renovations including mould remediation, improvements to lighting and millwork in patient rooms and nursing stations, as well as the installation of medical gases and suction units to the bedside
Result: Access to medical gas and suction outlets at all 224 beds, improved accessibility in washrooms, and upgraded fire safety, electrical, mechanical and structural systems

Project: West Park Healthcare Centre - DBFM Brownfield Capital Redevelopment Project
Description: Construction of a new multi-storey building to replace old building
Result: Increased capacity for inpatient, ambulatory care, outreach, diagnostic and therapeutic services with a capacity of up to 314 beds (up to a 54-bed increase) upon opening.

Project: William Osler Health System - Etobicoke General Hospital New Patient Tower
Description: Construction of a new four-storey tower
Result: Improved emergency department, critical care services and various ambulatory and support services.

Project: New Women's College Hospital (Rebuild)
Description: Construction of a new building at the Grenville Street site
Result: Services from 3 different locations concentrated in new location, while a new Centre of Excellence in Women’s Health will be created in a 630,000-sq. ft. building

Project: Scarborough Health Network - Diagnostic Imaging Project
Description: This project involves renovations at the Scarborough Health Network’s General Campus to expand and consolidate diagnostic imaging services and construction of a modernized Operating Room.
Result: Improved and expanded access to modernized diagnostic imaging services and surgical services.

Project: University Health Network Princess Margaret Cancer Centre
Description: Creation of additional inpatient allogenic stem cell transplant beds, expanded pharmacy services and creation of laboratory facilities.
Result: Increased inpatient capacity for allogenic stem cell transplant (STC), expanded pharmacy  services to support growth in SCT, and creation of a laboratory facility to meet provincial wait time standards.

Project: St. Joseph's Healthcare (Toronto) - Phase 3 and 4 Redevelopment
Description: This project is the final phase of new construction and renovations to modernize outdated facilities for maternal/newborn service
Result: Addition of 2 surgical inpatient units, increased  capacity for an up to 6-bed child/adolescent mental health unit, and additional capacity for an up to 28-bed medical unit.

Project: Scarborough Health Network - Chronic Kidney Disease Facility
Description: Construction of a facility to accommodate community based chronic kidney disease programs, including dialysis as part of the Bridletowne Neighbourhood Centre
Result: Increased access in a modern facility for patients requiring chronic kidney disease programs, including dialysis.

Project: Scarborough Health Network - Centenary Site Emergency -Department Redevelopment
Description: New construction and renovations to expand the emergency department
Result: Improved Emergency Department service capacity and quality

Project: Princess Margaret Hospital - Stem Cell Transplant Phase 2 Expansion
Description: Expansion of inpatient capacity by creating additional allogeneic  beds with HEPA filtration and positive pressurization; creation of a malignant hematology day hospital,  and expansion of ambulatory clinic space.
Result: Increased capacity and  quality of existing services and reduction of out of country referrals

Project: Centre For Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) - Phase 1D Redevelopment
Description: Construction of a new building to accommodate expanded inpatient capacity and ambulatory services for the forensic mental health program.
Result: Improved access to mental health and addiction services.

Project: North York General Hospital - Inpatient Redevelopment
Description: The project involves the construction of a new inpatient care tower to include new and expanded operating rooms, a new emergency department and increased inpatient bed capacity.  Renovations will also be undertaken in the existing building to expand support services, including medical device processing, laboratory and pharmacy.
Result: Increased access to expanded inpatient capacity and acute care services, as well as upgraded and modernized facilities to address growth and demand for services.

Project: Scarborough Health Network - Birchmount (Phase 1a) Redevelopment
Description: Redevelopment and expansion of Scarborough Health Network's Birchmount site.
Result: Service expansion and Improved access to upgraded and modernized facilities.

Project: Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre - Brain Sciences Centre
Description: The Brain Sciences Centre project includes the construction of a new, 3-storey building adjacent to the existing F-wing on the Bayview campus and renovations in the existing building.
Result: Additional beds and increased program space, and infrastructure improvement.

Project: The Hospital for Sick Children - Project Horizon
Description: Construction of a new patient care tower and renovations to the atrium wing. The new and renovated areas will house critical care, surgery, bone marrow transplant, diagnostic imaging, specialty outpatient clinics, emergency, and surgical departments.
Result: Better integration of emerging technology and innovations into improved models of patient care, and creation of additional capacity to meet projected growth forecasts.

Project: Unity Health (St. Joseph's Health Centre Toronto) - Major Capital Redevelopment Project
Description: This major project will renovate existing space, and add new space
Result: The project addresses aging infrastructure and adds new space to allow for progrm an service expansion.

Project: North York General Hospital - Branson Site Reactivation Care Centre
Description: The project involves renovations to the East Wing of the  Branson site to create a reactivation care centre to support Alternate Levels of Care patients.
Result: This project provides increased bed capacity for Alternative Level of Care patients, freeing up capacity for acute care patients.

Project: Mackenzie Health - New Vaughan Hospital (formerly York Central Hospital)
Description: Construction of a new hospital to be located in Vaughan and to become the second site of a two-site hospital model for Mackenzie Health
Result: Expanded services (e.g. acute inpatient and intensive care beds, emergency, surgical, and surgery, diagnostic imaging services) and fully integrated smart technology (first of its kind in Canada)

Project: North Wellington Health Care Corporation - ER/Ambulatory Care Project
Description: Redevelopment of the Emergency Department and Ambulatory Care areas . The project also includes the creation space for the Medical Education Facilities at both the Mount Forest and Palmerston sites.  The project will accommodate increased visits to the Emergency Department and Ambulatory Care areas.
Result: Expansion of sevice capacity and infrastructure improvement.

Project: Windsor Hotel Dieu Grace - Cardiac Catheritization Lab Project
Description: Relocation and expansion of the current cardiac catheterization lab in order to implement a 2-Cath table model of care that would enable provision of 24-hour Cath Lab services.   unit to two labs and relocating the day surgery program
Result: Improved access to 24/7 cath lab services; improved continuum of care for cardiac patients; reduced transfers to alternate healthcare facilities in the United States.

Project: Windsor Regional Hospital - New Windsor-Essex Regional Hospital
Description: The new Windsor-Essex hospital will be a multi-level community-based acute care facility with an array of programs and services on a greenfield site.
Result: Expansion of service, improvement of infrastructure and access to health care services for residents in the Windsor-Essex region.

Project: Hotel-Dieu Grace Healthcare - Mental Health Inpatient Bed Expansion
Description: Renovations at the Tayfour site to facilitate program expansion and the transfer of mental health beds from Windsor Regional Hospital
Result: Improved access to mental health services for area residents

Project: St. Joseph's Health Centre Long Term Care
Description: Construction of new building
Result: 128 long-term care beds, café, gathering areas and hair salon

Project: Mattawa Rural Northern Health Hub
Description: Construct and equip an additional 7,080 sf on the existing hospital site, in concert with the relocation and construction of the new Algonquin Nursing Home.
Result: Provide fully integrated quality health services while building on existing assets

Project: Nipissing Serenity Hospice
Description: Construct a 10-bed hospice.

Project: Algonquin Nursing Home - New Respite Care Services, Hospice Suite and Indigenous Healing Room
Description: The Rural Health Hub project was initiated as a result of the Ministry of Health and Long Term Care's approval to award the Algonquin Nursing Home $15,000,000 to relocate and reconstruct the home on the Mattawa Hospital site. Project consist of the capital construction (7080 sf) and equipment costs associated with the addition of the following services on the existing hospital site, in concert with the relocation and construction of the new Algonquin Nursing Home.
Result: Construction of a health hub and 1 hospice bed.

Project: Red Lake Hospital Indigenous Fire Circle
Description: Build a sitting area around a fire circle at the Red Lake Hospital.
Result: To help patients' and family wellbeing when visiting the hospital.

Project: Thunder Bay Regional Health Sciences Centre Regional Data Centre
Description: Relocation and expansion of data centre
Result: New 4,500-sq. ft data centre to provide improved health-care data management services for all hospitals in Northern Ontario.
